title: Cylinder - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Thoroughly clean the mating surfaces of the crankcase and cylinder. Take care not to damage the mating surfaces.
Apply a layer of Loctite 5910 or equivalent to the mating faces of the new base gasket.
Refit the locating dowels and install the new base gasket.
Rotate the crankshaft and use a suitable spacer to support the piston whilst preventing contact with the crankcase.
Do not allow the piston to fall against the crankcase when turning the engine. Piston and/or crankcase damage could occur if the piston is not supported while turning the engine.
Make sure the piston ring end gaps are correctly positioned (see
Make sure the cylinder and piston are clean prior to installation.
Lubricate the piston rings and the cylinder bore with clean engine oil.
Do not allow the full weight of the cylinder to rest unsupported on the piston. Failure to support the cylinder can result in piston ring breakage.

Do not force the piston into the bore. The base of the bore is chamfered to ease installation and excess force should not be needed. If the piston jams, lift the cylinder slightly and make sure that the rings are correctly located into their grooves before continuing. The use of force can result in piston ring breakage.
With the aid of an assistant, ease the cylinder carefully over the piston while guiding the piston rings into the base of the cylinder bore.
Slide the cylinder fully down, remove the spacers and locate on the dowels.
Install the front guide rail for the camshaft drive chain
Check the tensioner plunger location against the camshaft drive chain tensioner blade.
Seat, Battery and Fuel Tank Installation T*1
